Contributing Guide

We welcome contributions to PyQt Live Tuner! Follow these steps to contribute:

  1. Fork the Repository:

    Fork the repository on GitHub to create your own copy.

  2. Clone Your Fork:

    Clone your fork locally to start working on it:

    git clone https://github.com/your-username/pyqt-live-tuner.git

  3. Create a New Branch:

    Create a new branch for your feature or bugfix:

    git checkout -b feature-name

  4. Set Up the Development Environment:

    Install the required dependencies:

    pip install -r requirements-dev.txt

  5. Make Your Changes:

    Edit the code and add tests for your changes. Ensure your code follows the project’s style guidelines.

  6. Run Tests:

    Run the test suite to ensure your changes don’t break existing functionality:

    pytest tests

  7. Commit Your Changes:

    Commit your changes with a descriptive message:

    git add .
git commit -m "Description of changes"

  8. Push Your Branch:

    Push your branch to your fork on GitHub:

    git push origin feature-name

  9. Open a Pull Request:

    Open a pull request on the main repository. Provide a clear description of your changes and link to any related issues.

  10. Code Review:

    Address any feedback from the maintainers during the code review process.

  11. Style Guidelines:

    • Follow PEP 8 for Python code.

    • Use meaningful variable and function names.

    • Add docstrings to all public classes and methods.
